UserProfile.title: User Profile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user of the Lyra application, who can be either a student or a teacher.

uid.description: The unique Firebase Authentication user ID.

role.description: The user's role in the application.

school.description: The school the user belongs to.

classesTaught.description: The classes taught by the teacher.

subjectsTaught.description: The subjects taught by the teacher.

Prompt.title: Prompt
Prompt.description: Represents a prompt used to guide the AI tutor.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Prompt entity.

systemInstructions.description: Instructions that define the AI's role (e.g., tutor, coding assistant).

userInstructions.description: The actual question or problem from the student.

domain.description: The specific subject area (e.g., math, coding, essays).

guidanceLevel.description: Defines the amount of guidance the AI gives (more hints, more direct explanations, etc.).

exampleAnswers.description: Examples of good answers to guide the AI's response generation (few-shot prompting).

userId.description: Reference to the UserProfile. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Prompt). The user (teacher) who created or customized the prompt.

TeacherSettings.title: Teacher Settings
TeacherSettings.description: Stores AI customization settings for a teacher, organized by subject.

teacherId.description: The UID of the teacher these settings belong to.

subject.description: The subject these settings apply to (e.g., 'Maths', 'Physics').

systemPrompt.description: The custom system prompt defined by the teacher for this subject.

exampleAnswers.description: A list of good answer examples for few-shot prompting.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support the Lyra application, focusing on ethical AI tutoring. It prioritizes authorization independence and simplifies security rules using denormalization. The structure enables teachers to create and customize prompts that guide the AI's tutoring style. Since users log in with Firebase Authentication, all data will be secured by `request.auth.uid`. 

The structure is segregated to ensure each collection has a homogeneous security posture.  Specifically, prompts are stored under the teacher's ID to ensure that prompts are isolated between teachers and that list operations are safe. This prevents unauthorized access and maintains data integrity.

Authorization Independence is achieved by storing the `teacherId` within the prompt document, eliminating the need for `get()` calls to verify ownership.

QAPs are supported by the path-based ownership model for the prompts. Only the teacher associated with a prompt (via `teacherId`) can access or modify it.
